attributes.action: design a policy on "winding" babies to address childcare concerns in the case of two police officers whose baby has tragically died
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Further to Billie Jan's petitions, requesting more advice on colic, can I advisedly petition the govt. to create a guide for care workers on winding and patting babies' backs -

The case that is going to the High Court, though reported as "severe shaking" - may well have been the age old practice of "winding" - with no mens rea - in which case, this is unprosecutable as murder or manslaughter.

In accordance with UNICEF's excellent baby - friendly initiative - can I recommend that advice should include what to do in cases of constipation, use of water supplements, and recommended pharmaceuticals etc.

Colic is a problem, isn't it ! 

The worldwide Back to Sleep initiative has been a great international success to tackle unexplained infant deaths - each of them, of coure, a tragedy - I would like to urge the P.M. to develop an NHS policy that addresses dangers and treatments of handling.

Although NHS staff practice to the best of current medical knowledge, confusion still remains about clotting e.g. oral or IV administration advice - on anti - coagulant Vit K policy, which is inconsistent ! so the indication is there. 

Thanks.
